member.name: IPersistStreamInit.GetSizeMax
member.summary: Retrieves the size of the stream needed to save the object.
member.param: The size in bytes of the stream needed to save this object, in bytes.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK to indicate that the size was retrieved successfully.

member.name: IPersistStreamInit.InitNew
member.summary: Initializes an object to a default state. This method is to be called instead of .

returns.para: This method can return the standard return valuesE_OUTOFMEMORY and E_UNEXPECTED, as well as the following values.

listheader.description: The object requires no default initialization. This error code is allowed because an object may choose to implement simply for orthogonality or in anticipation of a future need for this method.

member.name: IPersistStreamInit.IsDirty
member.summary: Determines whether an object has changed since it was last saved to its stream.
member.returns: This method returns S_OK to indicate that the object has changed. Otherwise, it returns S_FALSE.

member.name: IPersistStreamInit.Load
member.summary: Initializes an object from the stream where it was saved previously.
member.param: An pointer to the stream from which the object should be loaded.

returns.para: This method can return the following values.

listheader.description: The object was not loaded due to lack of memory.
The object was not loaded due to some reason other than a lack of memory.

member.name: IPersistStreamInit.Save
member.summary: Saves an object to the specified stream.
member.param: An pointer to the stream into which the object should be saved.
Indicates whether to clear the dirty flag after the save is complete. If TRUE, the flag should be cleared. If FALSE, the flag should be left unchanged.

returns.para: This method can return the following values.

listheader.description: The object could not save itself to the stream. This error could indicate, for example, that the object contains another object that is not serializable to a stream or that an call returned STG_E_CANTSAVE.
The object could not be saved because there is no space left on the storage device.
